p.s: Worne wants to convince the reader that there is a great lack of education when it comes to foreign languages.
Therefore he uses communicative strategies and language.
Already in the first paragraph, Worne only states a decline in university level (l. 3), but gives no information about the other levels.
The reason for it is to focus on the most negative aspects, so the reader thinks the whole situation is corresponding.
Worne uses thsi strategy probably throughout the whole text.
He also uses inclusive speech to give the impression he is on the same siteside as the reader (l. 5,32).
inIn the second paragraph, Worne uses figurative speech there's a long haul ahead(l. 7) to show that the mentioned progress is not a reason to think that the siutation is getting better.
He creates the impression that the progress is totoo far away to have an effect.
In line 8, he calls the uptake of languages stalled which is by iteself a nutralneutral fact, but seems, because of the bad connotation of stalled, negative.

Worne uses also in the thirtthird paragraph figurative speech by calling the decrease of foreign language exams a drop(l. 10) which has a greater effect on the reader because it seems much more visually extreme.

The following three paragraphs build a construct to refute any last dissidents of Worne's opinion / perception: Thethe first presents counterarguments, which are shown as nonsense by exeggerationexaggeration enabelenable intercultural telepathy anyway(l. 15).
To refute them, Worne uses various arguments in the second paragraph which support his view.
The thirtthird paragraph is then used to create liability by using facts and information given by the CBI / Pearson Education and Skill Survey (l. 19-22).

In the seventh paragraph, Worne tries to give the impression of objectivity by also giving a positive development, but to, again, refute the idea of a generally positive development / situation, he points out that it is The only really good piece of news(l. 25).
Worne strengthens the mentioned appeal to students and parents by giving reasons like in line 27, which supports the indirect reason for parents in line 34 essential strings to....
All in all, Worne tries to introduce the reader to the situation while trying to seem objective, but actually overpresenting negative developementsdevelopments.
Then, he adresses possible counterarguments and refutsrefutes them.
Thereby is the final goal to convince the reader to change the situation, which is shown by WsW's appeals.
